ABOUT.DESCRIPTION: This Energy Management System is based on OpenEMS – the Open Source Energy Management System. OpenEMS is a modular platform for monitoring and controlling energy devices. Development is coordinated by the OpenEMS Association e.V.
ABOUT.CONTACT: For questions or feedback please visit the OpenEMS Community Forum.
ABOUT.DEVELOPED: This user interface is developed as open-source software.
ABOUT.PATCHNOTES: Changes in the monitoring for this build

EMERGENCY_RESERVE.INFO_FOR_EMERGENCY_RESERVE_SLIDER: By activating the emergency power reserve, the value can be freely selected between 5% and 100%.

ENERGYMONITOR.TITLE: Energy monitor
ENERGYMONITOR.ERROR_TEMPORARY: Error while fetching data. Please try again later.

WIDGETS.AUTARCHY_INFO: Autarchy indicates the percentage of current power that can be covered by generation and storage discharge.
WIDGETS.PHASES_INFO: For technical reasons, the sum of the individual phases can slightly deviate from the total sum.
WIDGETS.SELFCONSUMPTION_INFO: Self-consumption indicates the percentage of the currently generated output that can be used by direct consumption and storage charging.
WIDGETS.TWO_WAY_INFO_GRID: Negative values correspond to grid feed-in, Positive values correspond to mains supply
WIDGETS.INFO_STORAGE_FOR_CHARGE: Negative values correspond to storage charging
WIDGETS.INFO_STORAGE_FOR_DISCHARGE: Positive values correspond to storage discharge

SINGLETHRESHOLD.MORE_THAN_MAX_POWER: Value must not be lower than the maximum power of the controlled device
SINGLETHRESHOLD.RELATION_ERROR: Threshold must be greater than the switched load power

DELAYED_SELL_TO_GRID.RELATION_ERROR: Charge limit must be greater than the Discharge limit

PEAKSHAVING.ASYMMETRIC_INFO: The entered performance values ​​refer to individual phases. It is adjusted to the most stressed phase.
PEAKSHAVING.RELATION_ERROR: Discharge limit must be greater than or equal to the charge limit

GRID_OPTIMIZED_CHARGE.END_TIME_DESCRIPTION: The charging does not take place with the maximum amount for a few hours, but steadily over a longer period of time.
GRID_OPTIMIZED_CHARGE.END_TIME_DETAILED_DESCRIPTION: The charging does not take place with the maximum amount for a few hours, but steadily with a maximum of {{ value1 }} to {{ value2 }} o'clock.
GRID_OPTIMIZED_CHARGE.EXPECTED_SOC_WITHOUT_SELL_TO_GRID_LIMIT: Without avoiding the maximum grid feed-in

HISTORY.BATTERY_CHARGE_GRID_LIMIT_DESCRIPTION: The maximum grid feed-in, above which battery charging is increased (as far as possible) is below the maximum permitted grid feed-in in order to prevent premature production curtailment.
HISTORY.PRIORITY_DESCRIPTION: The minimum charge has a higher priority than the maximum charge

LOW.FUNCTION_DESCRIPTION: Comparatively early charging of the battery
LOW.STORAGE_DESCRIPTION: Higher probability that the battery is fully charged
LOW.PV_CURTAIL: Lower probability that curtailment of the PV installation is avoided

MEDIUM.FUNCTION_DESCRIPTION: Comparatively uniform charging of the battery
MEDIUM.STORAGE_DESCRIPTION: High probability that the battery is fully charged
MEDIUM.PV_CURTAIL: High probability that curtailment of the PV installation is avoided

HIGH.FUNCTION_DESCRIPTION: Comparatively late charging of the battery
HIGH.STORAGE_DESCRIPTION: Lower probability that the battery is fully charged
HIGH.PV_CURTAIL: Higher probability that curtailment of the PV installation is avoided

GRID_OPTIMIZED_CHARGE.SETTING_ONLY_VISABLE_FOR_INSTALLER: This setting is only visible to the installer

STATE.NO_LIMIT_POSSIBLE: No limitation possible (restricted by controls with higher priority)
STATE.PASSED_END_TIME: End time of limited charging exceeded

EVCS.CHARGING_STATION_PLUGGED_IN_EVLOCKED: Charing Station + E-Vehicel plugged in + locked
EVCS.CLUSTER_CONFIG_ERROR: An error has occurred in the configuration of the Evcs cluster
EVCS.ENERGY_SINCE_BEGINNING: Energy since the last charge start

ADMINISTRATION.CUSTOM_CAR_INFO: If this is the case, your car can only be charged efficiently from a certain output. With this button, this is included in your configuration options as well as in the automatic charging calculations.
ADMINISTRATION.RENAULT_ZOE: Is a Renault Zoe mainly charged on this charging station?

NO_CONNECTION.DESCRIPTION: No connection to the charging station.
NO_CONNECTION.HELP1_1: The IP of the charging station appears when switching on again
NO_CONNECTION.HELP1: Check if the charging station is switched on and can be reached via the network.

OPTIMIZED_CHARGE_MODE.INFO: In this mode, the load of the car is adjusted to the current production and consumption.
OPTIMIZED_CHARGE_MODE.MIN_INFO: If you want to prevent that the car is not charging at the night, you could set a minimum charge.
OPTIMIZED_CHARGE_MODE.NAME: Optimized charging

CHARGING_PRIORITY.INFO: Depending on the prioritization, the selected component will be loaded first

FORCE_CHARGE_MODE.INFO: In this mode the loading of the car is enforced, i.e. it is always guaranteed that the car will be charged, even if the charging station needs to access grid power.
FORCE_CHARGE_MODE.MAX_CHARGING_DETAILS: If the car can not load the entered maximum value, the power will be automatically limited.
FORCE_CHARGE_MODE.NAME: Force charging

EVCS.UNCONTROLLABLE: This charging station can not be controlled.
EVCS.HYSTERESIS: Minimum switching time of the charging station active
EVCS.HYSTERESIS_INFO: For preventing charging interruptions due to frequent starting/pausing of the charing process, the charging mode currently selected will continue for the next few minutes.

HEATINGELEMENT.CALIBRATION_DESCRIPTION: The heating element is calibrated to get the power of the single levels of the meter
HEATINGELEMENT.MESSAGE_UNREACHABLE: The energy limit can't be reached in time

HEAT.CHANGES_MY_PV_INFO: You can make changes to the settings of your AC-Thor heating element in your MyPV app.

HEAT_PUMP.ABOVE_SOC: and from the state of charge of
HEAT_PUMP.BELOW_SOC: and below state of charge of
HEAT_PUMP.MORE_THAN_HP_POWER: The value must not be lower than the maximum output of the heat pump
HEAT_PUMP.RELATION_ERROR: Switch-on command excess value must be greater than switch-on recommended value

TIME_OF_USE_TARIFF.CHART_WARNING_NOTE: The graphic shows the past three hours as well as the future planned operating mode for the period for which the dynamic grid purchase prices are available. Please note that the planned schedule is subject to continuous recalculation and may change throughout the day.

INDUSTRIAL.NOTE: Starts or stops the entire system, including battery inverter and batteries.

STORAGE.GRID_CHARGE: Activate maintenance of the emergency power reserve from the grid
STORAGE.GRID_CHARGE_WARNING:
The storage system can actively recharge from the grid to maintain the set emergency power reserve in order to compensate for losses due to internal self-consumption in the event of a prolonged absence of generation.

ATTENTION: Actively charging the battery from grid beyond the technically necessary maintenance charging, requires an appropriate registration of the storage system. If in doubt, please verify with your installer. By pressing the blue "Save" button you confirm that this verification has been done.

Be aware: precondition for German "Gesetz für den Ausbau erneuerbarer Energien (EEG)" grant is, that only energy from renewable sources and/or pit gas is stored in the battery. By activating this function, the battery is charged with energy from grid. This energy is, depending on the individual power-supply contract, probably made from fossil sources and/or nuclear power plants. Because of this we can not guarantee, that the battery is only charged with energy from renewable sources and/or pit gas.

REFERENCING_OF_STORAGE.HEADER: Please note that the battery must be referenced before expanding the capacity
REFERENCING_OF_STORAGE.CONTENT: Before a capacity expansion, the battery must be referenced in the days before the capacity expansion takes place. This means that it must be fully discharged (SOC: 0 %) and then fully charged (SOC: 100 %).

RETROFITTING.INFORMATION_FOR_PL_ANNED_EXPANSION: The battery is expected to be charged/discharged from {{targetTime}} on {{targetDate}} to reach reach {{targetSoc}} % state of charge for the planned expansion. In the process there may be grid consumption or grid feed-in. This state of charge is maintained for {{targetTimeBuffer}} minutes, after which or after the capacity expansion, the storage system returns to the regular operating state.
RETROFITTING.INFORMATION_FOR_INSTANT_START: The battery is charged or discharged at maximum power in order to reach a state of charge of {{targetSoc}} % as quickly as possible for an expansion. This can result in grid consumption or grid feed-in. This state of charge is maintained for {{targetTimeBuffer}} minutes, after which, or after the capacity has been expanded, the storage system returns to its regular operating state.
RETROFITTING.INFORMATION_FOR_PL_ANNED_EXPANSION_INVAL: The battery is expected to be charged/discharged to reach {{targetSoc}} % state of charge for the planned expansion.
RETROFITTING.UPDATE_TO_NEW_VERSION: Update to the newest version to be able to use the battery retrofitting feature.
RETROFITTING.TARGET_TIME_SPECIFIED: Capacity Extension will be performed on {{targetDate}} at {{targetTime}}

KEY.ALREADY_REGISTERED_DIFFERENT_SYSTEM: Key already got registered on a different System! If you continue the other registration will get removed.
KEY.ALREADY_REGISTERED_DIFFERENT_APP: Key already got registered for an app on this System! If you continue the other registration will get removed.
KEY.KEY_TYPO_MESSAGE_HINT:
Note: When entering the licence key, watch out for possible typos:
  • small L "l" vs. capital i "I"
  • zero "0" vs. capital o "O"
We always recommend copying the licence key from the delivery note and pasting it into the field above instead of typing it in manually.
KEY.MASTER_KEY_HINT: Note: The master key is used in the background. No key is displayed. If a licence key is available, please use it.
